pullRequest.title: [IPC part 5.5] make changes to support the Broker API work.

nodes.bodyText: Can we describe this via a schema rather than a number?  Might be brokerApi/1.0.

So smaller and larger don't really mean anything for communication APIs.  The only real question is, "can I understand a message in this format" and "could you understand a message I send".  Better still is a mechanism that would enable you to send appropriate messages or understand them.  Much like we decoupled communication channel from content, the actual message content can be separated into message, structure, and encoding.  The message is something represented by an abstract schema, the structure of the message, and the encoding on the message - what's in it, how can I read it (JSON, protobuf, xml), and what do I need to do to what you send in order to read it (gzip, base64, etc)?  That's kind of the North Star here, to be able to fiddle around with these three different aspects of communication independently.
Now, I'm not saying that we should get there now, but if we're putting together a new mechanism (the broker-broker api distinction) there's an opportunity to get closer, maybe.  This is a long comment to say that we should write the method not about smaller or larger, but basically based on whether we can understand the message that will be sent.
Do we want to allow parameters to be null here?  I see this, and I think we should have another method that doesn't take parameters rather than one that allows it to be null.

commit.message: [IPC part 5.5] make changes to support the Broker API work

afterCommit.message: [IPC part 5.5] make changes to support the Broker API work
